rules.natural: Either wolves were observed in the forest, or conservation in the forest was successful.
If data on wolves were analyzed, then the movement of wolves was tracked.
Provided that data on wolves were reviewed, the migration of deer was not disrupted.
Under the condition that a report on wolves was submitted, either data on wolves were analyzed or data on wolves were reviewed.
A report on wolves was submitted, or a report on wolves was presented.
Whenever a report on wolves was presented, either data on wolves were analyzed or data on wolves were reviewed.
Protection was implemented in the forest, or protection was enforced in the forest.
Given that protection was enforced in the forest, the forest ecosystem was not damaged.
Provided that monitoring of wolves was established, if protection was implemented in the forest, then the forest ecosystem was not damaged.
If monitoring of wolves was continued, then monitoring of wolves was established.
The impact of protection was evaluated, or the impact of protection was assessed.
Given that the impact of protection was assessed, either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest, then conservation in the forest was successful.
If development activity was banned, then a development proposal was not rejected.
Industry encroached upon the forest, or a forest area was preserved, or conservation in the forest was successful.
A threat to the ecosystem was detected, or a threat to the ecosystem was identified.
Provided that a threat to the ecosystem was identified, industry did not encroach upon the forest.

Researchers collaborated with the community, or if it is not the case that if a threat to the ecosystem was detected then industry did not encroach upon the forest, then a threat to the ecosystem was mitigated.
Conservation efforts were coordinated, or researchers did not collaborate with the community.
Whenever human-wildlife conflict was avoided, the migration of deer was not disrupted.
Human-wildlife conflict occurred, or human-wildlife conflict was avoided.
Under the condition that prevention measures were implemented, human-wildlife conflict did not occur.
If management actions were recommended, then if prevention measures were not implemented, the community suffered losses.
Management actions were recommended, or management actions were adopted.
If management actions were adopted, then management actions were executed.
Whenever a study on deer was published, a decline in the deer population was documented.
Management actions were neglected, or if management actions were executed, then if prevention measures were not implemented, the community suffered losses.
If the forest habitat was protected, then conservation in the forest was successful.
Provided that a forest reserve was proposed, development did not disturb the forest.
If the forest reserve was approved, then development did not disturb the forest.
Provided that it is not the case that either deer were monitored during the spring or wolves were not observed in the forest, a study on deer was published.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(evaluated(impact, protection) -> (funded(project, conservation) | (maintained(biodiversity, forest) -> successful(conservation, forest)))) -> rejected(proposal, development))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that if the impact of protection was evaluated then either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest then conservation in the forest was successful, then a development proposal was rejected.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(evaluated(impact, protection) -> (funded(project, conservation) | (maintained(biodiversity, forest) -> successful(conservation, forest)))) -> banned(activity, development))
rules.natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the impact of protection was evaluated then either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest then conservation in the forest was successful, development activity was banned.
Provided that it is not the case that if a threat to the ecosystem was detected then industry did not encroach upon the forest, a threat to the ecosystem was not mitigated.
If it is not the case that either a forest reserve was proposed or the forest reserve was approved, then the migration of deer was disrupted.
If the forest habitat was not protected, then development disturbed the forest.
If conservation in the forest was not successful, then the forest ecosystem was damaged.

(A12 → ¬A9).natural: Provided that data on wolves were reviewed, the migration of deer was not disrupted.

(A14 → (A11 ∨ A12)).natural: Whenever a report on wolves was presented, either data on wolves were analyzed or data on wolves were reviewed.

(A17 → ¬A15).natural: Given that protection was enforced in the forest, the forest ecosystem was not damaged.

(A18 → (A16 → ¬A15)).natural: Provided that monitoring of wolves was established, if protection was implemented in the forest, then the forest ecosystem was not damaged.

(A19 → A18).natural: If monitoring of wolves was continued, then monitoring of wolves was established.

(A22 → (A21 ∨ (A20 → G))).natural: Under the condition that the impact of protection was evaluated, either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest, then conservation in the forest was successful.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: The impact of protection was evaluated, or the impact of protection was assessed.

(A23 → (A21 ∨ (A20 → G))).natural: Given that the impact of protection was assessed, either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest, then conservation in the forest was successful.

(A25 → ¬A24).natural: If development activity was banned, then a development proposal was not rejected.

(A26 ∨ G).natural: A forest area was preserved, or conservation in the forest was successful.

(A27 ∨ (A26 ∨ G)).natural: Industry encroached upon the forest, or a forest area was preserved, or conservation in the forest was successful.

(A28 → ¬A27).natural: If a threat to the ecosystem was detected, then industry did not encroach upon the forest.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: A threat to the ecosystem was detected, or a threat to the ecosystem was identified.

(A32 ∨ ¬A31).natural: Conservation efforts were coordinated, or researchers did not collaborate with the community.

(A35 → ¬A34).natural: Under the condition that prevention measures were implemented, human-wildlife conflict did not occur.

(A37 → (¬A35 → A36)).natural: If management actions were recommended, then if prevention measures were not implemented, the community suffered losses.
